item.title: Death to Myspace
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description:
I killed my myspace account in a fit of aggravation today... I had been pretty good about keeping personal posts on there and movie/art/gizmo related stuff on here, but now that I no longer have that as an outlet, don't be surprised if I occasionally have a little more candor on this blog.

The new website is really truly almost finished then I'll be trying out weekly pieces of questionable and confusing video. We'll see if it works out.

item.title: COLOSSUS: THE FORBIN PROJECT
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description:
I Watched this great 70's cold war SF flick a few nights ago. Aside from the irresistible 70's punchcard-and-magnetic reel computer porn of it, The plot, pacing, and acting have a lot of appeal. A real gem.

Eccentric cinema: COLOSSUS: THE FORBIN PROJECT
Cinemageddon: Colossus...



Dave Brasgalla has made some excellent Colossus icons and desktops for OS X.
You can find them here:

http://www.pixelhuset.se

item.title: Back
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description:
I'm back from Park City, sick (is it possible to go to Sundance and not get sick?) I had a good time, met some very cool people from Wholphen and Rooftop films, and also Cinevegas programmer Mike Plante, who curated this year's Frontier Lounge, which was one of the highlights of the festival for me. On display in the lounge were a couple of really nice installations by Daniel Rozen.

I didn't get to see many films (again), just two showings of The Zellner's heartbreaking, funny Goliath (one of four movies total that has ever made me cry. Never you mind what the others are). A swedish film called King of Ping-Pong and The Duplass' Baghead.

I've started working on this vaporous podcast that I keep telling myself I will be cranking out weekly, but it's been very hard to decide on tone and content. I'm hoping it will be a collaborative thing with all my friends, but everyone always seems so busy, it's difficult to get momentum.

item.title: Mind Hacks: Polanski and the Professor
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description:
It was 1970, and a white Rolls Royce was gliding through the streets of London. Inside were the obviously disturbed Roman Polanski, the film director still reeling from the murder of his wife, and Richard Gregory, the legendary cognitive psychologist.

Polanski had discovered Gregory's work on visual perception through his book Eye and Brain and decided he wanted to enlist Gregory's help to create a 3D horror movie.

The movie was intended to be revolutionary, taking advantage of the brain's perceptual quirks to make a truly disturbing visual experience.

[...]Interestingly, Gregory also mentions that Polanksi also wanted to use the techniques they developed to make a 3D erotic movie.


Mind Hacks: Polanski and the Professor

item.title: Bud Cort! 2001, The Thing! I love the Alamo Drafthouse.
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description:
The Alamo Drafthouse is bringing Bud Cort to town for screenings of Brewster McCloud and Harold and Maude on March 18th. I've always had a soft spot for Bud Cort, who had a string of interesting roles (that unfortunately typecast him as a slightly creepy pretty-boy) in the 70's and survived a terrible car wreck before the 80's began, leaving him dealing with multiple plastic surgeries and rehab during what should have been the height of his career. He's held strong and continues to do great character work (Wes Anderson finally got to take his Hal Ashby fixation to it's logical conclusion by giving Bud a role as the kidnapped functionary in The Life Aquatic).

It looks like The Drafthouse and Red Bull are going to be putting on another outdoor showing of Dazed and Confused on March 12th (the last one was a reunion show in 2003 that got a good chunk of the original cast to show up). I'll be helping host, but I don't have a lot of details yet. Christ, I just love seeing myself prance around and grab my face as a fifteen year old over and over for the rest of my life. :) Let's all get toasty and re-live the magic.

April is going to bring screenings of 2001: A Space Odyssey, The Thing, and Blade Runner: The Final Cut. I haven't seen what print they've got of 2001, but I'm sure if they are having an event for it that it's probably pristine. I'm pretty sure I've seen the Thing print they've got at the last Cinemuerte festival and it was in great condition. If you missed the new cleaned up Blade Runner at the Paramount, make sure and catch it at the Alamo, it's really wonderful.

I've barely cracked the new Alamo Calandar and I'm already very excited.

item.title: Filmmaking Frenzy! BeastMaster
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description:
My friend Thomas, who I've helped on a few Alamo filmmaking contests, has posted his entry to the Be Kind Rewind! contest. If you think it's as funny as I do, log onto the filmmaking frenzy site and give it a good rating so more people will see it!
Update: Looks like Thomas has won the competition! Congrats!

item.title: SXSW 2008
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description: So I'm attending every part of SXSW this year, I was on the interactive advisory board, I have a little part in one of the films, and I just found out that the band I am in is playing a day show. Who is coming to town, and who is going to what? email/twitter/im me as stuff develops. I'm going to start putting my calendar together today.

item.title: Vintage anime: Evil Mickey Mouse invasion! ::: Pink Tentacle
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description:
"Toy Box Series, Episode 3: Picture Book 1936” (Omocha-Bako Series, Dai-3-Wa: Ehon 1936) is a 1934 propaganda-ish film about a future (1936) conflict started by a swarm of evil, bat-riding Mickey Mouse clones that descend on a tiny island inhabited by peace-loving dolls and cats (including a Felix lookalike)...
Read full article

Found on Pink Tentacle

item.title: Filmmaking Frenzy: BPM
item.dc:creator: weevil@wileywiggins.com (Wiley Wiggins)
item.description:
I'll be announcing the winning BPM Filmmaking Frenzy video the night of the Dazed and Confused screening (March 12th) at the Red Bull Moon Tower. I just found out that it's the same day that Diagonals are playing a day show, so it will be a busy day for me on top of a just generally crazy festival.
On Friday, Feb 29, all registered Austin teams will meet up at the preparty (location TBA). At 7:00 PM teams will be handed a CD containing two tracks. Your team must conceive, shoot, edit and output a music video for one of the two tracks on the CD. Out of town teams will have access to a downloadable MP3 beginning at 7:00 PM CST.

Local teams must deliver a finished DVD to the afterparty (location TBD) by 7:00 PM CST on Sunday, Mar 2 and have the exact same film uploaded to the Filmmaking Frenzy website by noon the following day. Out of town teams must finish their upload to filmmakingfrenzy.com by 7:30 PM CST. Out of town teams must also send a DVD of their finished film, postmaked by March 3, to: Filmmaking Frenzy, attention Brad Parrett, 1120 South Lamar Blvd, Austin, TX 78704.

The top 40 ranked teams will be given 4 passes each to the Wednesday, March 12 "Dazed and Confused" night of Red Bull Moon Tower. The awards will be given out at this party and choice clips from the competition will be played on the Rolling Roadshow screen during set breaks of the bands. Wiley Wiggins, star of Dazed and Confused, will choose the winning film from the top 40 videos in the contest. The same videos will be posted on the Red Bull Moon Tower page on Facebook. Check out the Filmmaking Frenzy page on Facebook for more updates, songs, photos, videos and news.


Filmmaking Frenzy: Fiew Frenzy
